intro: Malache muricata, commonly known as the rough-leaved malache, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that are covered in small, raised bumps, giving them a textured appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically producing a fragrant scent that attracts pollinators. Malache muricata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
